newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - IBM remains halted.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - IBM remains halted.

text.p: Shares in International Business Machines Corp remained halted for after-hours trade on Monday after the computer maker released second-quarter earnings of $1.46 per share, $0.04 above analysts' forecasts.
"On it's face it looks like a decent number," said one trader. "But I'm not sure it's going to be enough to drive the stock from here. I think you would have needed a better number for that."
IBM stock vacillated during Monday's regular trading session ahead of the earnings release and closed the day at an unofficial 103-11/16, down 1/2.

Also attracting traders' attention was Citrix Systems Inc, which announced second-quarter earnings of $0.29 per share after the close of the regular session, compared with a First Call consensus forecast of $0.24.
"They look about a nickel over," a trader said. Dealers said the multiuser computer applications supplier climbed to 56 after hours and then fell back to 55-1/4, spot on its market close.
McAfee Associates rose to 78 from an unofficial close of 77-1/4, after reporting earnings of $0.44 per share, or about three cents more than the First Call consensus.
Earlier, the Dow Jones Industrial Average ended 16 points at 7907 higher in a tentative session that in part reflected anticipation of the IBM release due after the close, analysts said.
The New York Stock Exchange said after-hours session No.1 volume was 1,900, down from Friday's 3,600. Session No. 2 volume dropped to 1,477,000 from 4,091,000.
